biotools.summary: Pooled CRISPR Inverse PCR sequencing (PCIP-seq) is a method that leverages selective cleavage of circularized DNA fragments carrying proviral DNA with a pool of CRISPR guide RNAs, followed by inverse long-range PCR and multiplexed sequencing on the Oxford Nanopore MinION platform.

bioschemas.name: PCIP-seq
bioschemas.summary: Pooled CRISPR Inverse PCR sequencing (PCIP-seq) is a method that leverages selective cleavage of circularized DNA fragments carrying proviral DNA with a pool of CRISPR guide RNAs, followed by inverse long-range PCR and multiplexed sequencing on the Oxford Nanopore MinION platform.
